alert.description: Multiple failed logins followed by a successful admin login from IP 203.0.113.12

recommendations: Isolate host web-server-1 from network.
Rotate the admin password and force MFA reset for the user.
Review recent login history and suspicious IP addresses.
Search for indicators of compromise on the host.
analysis.explanation: Multiple failed attempts followed by success suggests credential compromise.

alert.description: Endpoint AV found 'invoice.pdf.exe' flagged as trojan on host PC-23

recommendations: Quarantine PC-23.
Run full AV and collect memory dump.
Identify lateral movement and scan other endpoints.
Search for the file across the environment.
analysis.explanation: AV detected trojan-like file; treat as active compromise.

alert.description: Large outbound transfer to foreign IP 198.51.100.45 from db-server-2

recommendations: Block destination IP 198.51.100.45.
Isolate the DB host and stop data transfers.
Collect network and process logs for the last 24 hours.
Notify incident response and legal/compliance teams.
analysis.explanation: Large outbound transfer to suspicious IP indicates data theft risk.

alert.description: Endpoint AV found 'invoice.pdf.exe' flagged as trojan on host PC-23

Eradication: Run full AV and EDR cleanup
Reimage host if persistence is detected
Recovery: Rebuild systems as needed, bring back to production carefully
Post-Incident: Perform malware triage and IOC sharing

recommendations: Quarantine endpoint
Disable network interfaces for host
Run full AV and EDR cleanup
Reimage host if persistence is detected
Restore from clean backups
Rebuild systems as needed, bring back to production carefully
Perform malware triage and IOC sharing
Update detection rules
analysis.explanation: Threat categorized as Malware. Heuristic risk score 70 suggests High severity.

alert.description: I logged into my system this morning and found a new file , which wasnt created by me .

Containment: Force password reset and revoke sessions
Block suspicious source IPs at perimeter
Eradication: Search for indicators of compromise and remove backdoors
Recovery: Restore services and re-enable accounts with new credentials
Post-Incident: Perform root-cause analysis and update playbooks

recommendations: Isolate affected host from network
Force password reset and revoke sessions
Search for indicators of compromise and remove backdoors
Rotate credentials and reissue secrets
Restore services and re-enable accounts with new credentials
Monitor for re-occurrence
Perform root-cause analysis and update playbooks
User awareness/training if phishing involved
analysis.explanation: Threat categorized as Credential Compromise. Heuristic risk score 30 suggests Medium severity.
